conversion_verification.notes: 3D cutaway/isometric view with extruded walls (height + thickness), visible floor plane, and removed ceiling/roof exposing interior volumes.

3d_conversion_fundamentals.notes: Strong 3D extrusion with readable wall corners, thickness, and interior volume. Cutaway is clean and view is clearly angled with minimal distortion.

geometric_accuracy.notes: Overall room set and adjacency match (Activity left, Balcony bottom-left, Bath/WC central, Beds 2/3/4 to the right). However, several room proportions/dimensions shown in the 3D labels do not match the 2D plan (notably Activity and Bed 2/3 dimension strings), indicating scale/proportion drift.

interior_elements.notes: Beds and basic furnishings present in correct rooms; bathroom fixtures (tub, WC) present; balcony seating shown. Kitchen elements not applicable in this plan segment.

visual_clarity.notes: Geometry is generally clear and readable with good lighting, but extensive text labels on surfaces reduce presentation clarity; some openings/frames are less distinct due to similar materials.

detected_errors.description: Room proportion/scale drift: multiple labeled dimensions in the 3D render do not match the 2D plan (e.g., Activity and Bed 2/3 dimension strings), suggesting non-faithful scaling.
Some door/opening details are simplified; exact swing/placement fidelity is not fully verifiable from the render angle.
Text labels overlaid on floors in the 3D image contaminate presentation and reduce clarity.

summary: A true 3D cutaway conversion with strong volumetric walls and correct overall layout, but with notable proportion/scale mismatches versus the 2D plan and reduced clarity due to heavy text labeling.
